sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Lucky Strike Entertainment (NYSE:LUCK) - Stock Analysis
feed.summary: This report provides a comprehensive stock analysis of Lucky Strike Entertainment (NYSE:LUCK), detailing its financial health, past performance, future growth prospects, and analyst consensus. It highlights that while earnings are forecast to grow significantly, the dividend is not well covered, and the company has negative shareholder equity. The analysis also covers recent news, stock price performance, and key fundamental statistics.

feed.title: Lucky Strike Entertainment Corporation (NYSE:LUCK) Shares Fly 27% But Investors Aren't Buying For Growth
feed.summary: Lucky Strike Entertainment (NYSE:LUCK) shares have risen 27% in the last month but are still down 13% over the past year. The company's low price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 1x, compared to the industry average of 1.6x, suggests investors are cautious due to its lackluster revenue growth. Analysts forecast 5.4% annual revenue growth over the next three years, significantly lower than the broader industry's 14% forecast, explaining the stock's discounted valuation.

feed.title: Lucky Strike Entertainment (NYSE:LUCK) Given Consensus Recommendation of "Hold" by Analysts
feed.summary: Lucky Strike Entertainment (NYSE:LUCK) has received a consensus "Hold" rating from analysts, with a 12-month price target of $12.57, while the stock recently traded at $8.85. The company remains unprofitable, yet insiders have recently acquired shares, notably a director who bought 30,000 shares. Institutional investors also show increasing interest, with several firms initiating new stakes in the company.

feed.title: Jefferies reiterates Buy rating on Lucky Strike Entertainment stock By Investing.com
feed.summary: Jefferies has reiterated its Buy rating and an $18.00 price target for Lucky Strike Entertainment (NYSE:LUCK), implying nearly 100% upside from its current price of $9.04. The firm highlighted consistently solid, though decelerating, foot traffic trends and modest revenue growth for the company, aligning with recent strong Q1 2026 earnings that surpassed analyst expectations. Despite positive financial results, the stock saw a decline in aftermarket trading, reflecting investor caution.

feed.title: Analysts Offer Insights on Industrial Goods Companies: Byrna Technologies (BYRN), Innovative Solutions And Support (ISSC) and Watts Water Technologies (WTS)
feed.summary: Analysts have provided insights on several industrial goods companies, including Byrna Technologies (BYRN), Innovative Solutions And Support (ISSC), and Watts Water Technologies (WTS). Craig-Hallum analysts maintained "Buy" ratings for Byrna Technologies and Innovative Solutions And Support, while a KeyBanc analyst maintained a "Hold" rating for Watts Water Technologies. The article details the analyst consensus and average price targets for each company.

feed.title: Analysts Are Bullish on Top Consumer Goods Stocks: Ollie’s Bargain Outlet Holding (OLLI), Kroger Company (KR)
feed.summary: Analysts have issued bullish ratings for two consumer goods stocks: Ollie's Bargain Outlet Holding (OLLI) and Kroger Company (KR). Craig-Hallum analyst Jeremy Hamblin maintained a Buy rating for OLLI, projecting a 24.3% upside, while Guggenheim's John Heinbockel reiterated a Buy rating for KR, anticipating a 21.3% upside. Both companies are seen as strong investment opportunities within the sector.

feed.title: Lucky Strike Entertainment (NYSE:LUCK) Lowered to Sell Rating by Wall Street Zen
feed.summary: Wall Street Zen downgraded Lucky Strike Entertainment (NYSE:LUCK) from a "hold" to a "sell" rating. This decision comes despite an overall "Hold" consensus among analysts with an average price target of $11.67, and recent insider buying activity by Director Richard Meynard Born. The company's stock is currently trading near $8.52 with a negative P/E ratio, and it has reported quarterly revenue of $257.82 million with a negative net margin.

feed.title: 633,676 Shares in Lucky Strike Entertainment $LUCK Bought by Systematic Financial Management LP
feed.summary: Systematic Financial Management LP acquired 633,676 shares of Lucky Strike Entertainment (NYSE:LUCK) in Q2, valued at approximately $5.79 million. Other institutions like Champlain and Private Management also increased their stakes, bringing institutional and hedge fund ownership to about 68.11%. The company's stock currently holds a "Hold" consensus rating from analysts with an average target price of $11.67.

feed.title: Lucky Strike Entertainment (NYSE: LUCK) adds Aliso Viejo site to SoCal lineup
feed.summary: Lucky Strike Entertainment has announced the grand opening of its newest venue in Aliso Viejo, California, marking continued strategic expansion in Southern California. The nearly 38,000 square foot facility features 35 bowling lanes, a 60-game arcade, elevated dining from Cheeky Monkey Gastropub, and craft cocktails. The company aims to make the Aliso Viejo location a premier destination for entertainment and events.

feed.title: Lucky Strike Entertainment (NYSE:LUCK) Director Richard Meynard Born Purchases 30,000 Shares of Stock
feed.summary: Lucky Strike Entertainment (NYSE:LUCK) Director Richard Meynard Born acquired 30,000 shares of the company's stock on November 28th at an average price of $8.09 per share, totaling $242,700. This purchase significantly increases his holdings from zero to 30,000 shares. The company's stock was trading at $8.17, with a market cap of $1.14 billion and a consensus "Hold" rating from analysts with an average price target of $11.67.

feed.title: Champlain Investment Partners LLC Makes New Investment in Lucky Strike Entertainment $LUCK
feed.summary: Champlain Investment Partners LLC recently invested $23.77 million in Lucky Strike Entertainment (NYSE:LUCK), acquiring 2,603,890 shares. This move is part of several new institutional investments in the company, while an insider, President Lev Ekster, also increased his holdings. Despite a "Hold" consensus from analysts with a target price of $11.67, the company currently trades near its 52-week low with negative profitability metrics.

feed.title: 3 High-Flying Stocks That Concern Us
feed.summary: This article identifies three "high-flying" stocks—Lucky Strike (LUCK), Inspire Medical Systems (INSP), and Cognex (CGNX)—that raise concerns due to high valuations and underlying business issues despite their market success. The author details specific reasons for concern for each company, such as lagging sales, low free cash flow, or diminishing returns on capital. StockStory, the publisher, suggests investors look for high-quality stocks at a fraction of the price, referencing their own successful stock picks.

feed.title: Lucky Strike Entertainment: Feels Like A Gutter Ball (NYSE:LUCK) - Seeking Alpha
feed.summary: Lucky Strike Entertainment Corporation (LUCK) has seen over a 25% rebound from May 2025 lows due to optimism about improved same-store sales and business transformation plans. LUCK aims to diversify its revenue across bowling, water parks, and family entertainment centers for a 40/40/20 split within 5-10 years. Despite some positive indicators like sequential sales improvement and insider buying, the company faces significant challenges including heavy capital expenditure, negative free cash flow, and high leverage.

feed.title: Lucky Strike offers aid to Pinstripes customers, workers
feed.summary: Following Pinstripes Holdings Inc.'s Chapter 11 bankruptcy filing and closure of units, competitor Lucky Strike Entertainment Corp. is extending assistance to affected parties. Lucky Strike is providing courtesy discounts to displaced Pinstripes clients for their events at Lucky Strike's 350 national locations and inviting former Pinstripes employees to apply for open roles within their company. This move highlights Lucky Strike's strategy of thoughtful growth and commitment to their venues and customer experience, rather than direct competition.

feed.title: Lucky Strike Entertainment Reports Third Quarter Results for Fiscal Year 2025
feed.summary: Lucky Strike Entertainment (NYSE: LUCK) announced its financial results for the third quarter of fiscal year 2025, ending March 30, 2025. The company reported a slight revenue increase, but net income and Adjusted EBITDA decreased compared to the prior year. Despite macroeconomic uncertainties, Lucky Strike Entertainment is confident in its strategic initiatives and disciplined expense management, highlighting strong performance in its Summer Season Pass program and continued acquisitions.

feed.title: Bowlero Announces Rebranding to Lucky Strike Entertainment
feed.summary: Bowlero Corporation has officially rebranded as Lucky Strike Entertainment, marking an expansion beyond bowling to include various entertainment attractions. The company's legal name and stock ticker have changed, with plans to convert over 75 Bowlero centers into Lucky Strike locations within two years. Lucky Strike Entertainment now operates over 360 locations and owns the Professional Bowlers Association (PBA).

feed.title: The 3 best bowling alleys in Arizona, according to our readers
feed.summary: This article highlights the top three bowling alleys in Arizona as voted by readers: Lucky Strike in Tucson, Let it Roll Bowl & Entertainment in Phoenix, and Bowlero North in Scottsdale. Each location is praised for its unique blend of classic charm and modern amenities, offering a full entertainment experience for families, friends, and serious bowlers alike. The article details the specific features and community involvement of each top-rated alley.

feed.title: Former Bowlero exec says company threatened to report him to FBI in proposed extortion, retaliation suit
feed.summary: A former Bowlero CIO, Thomas Tanase, is seeking to countersue the company for extortion and retaliation, alleging that a Bowlero executive threatened to report him to the FBI if he didn't admit to leaking company secrets. This comes after Bowlero sued Tanase for allegedly hacking into the CEO's email and amid an ongoing EEOC investigation since 2016 into age discrimination and retaliation claims against Bowlero involving over 70 former employees. Both Bowlero and Tanase deny the respective allegations against them, with Tanase seeking millions in damages.
